content.question: Let f be a function that is continuous on the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A4F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BDE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following is guaranteed by the Intermediate Value Theorem?

choices.label: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C22@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has at least one solution in the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

f attains a maximum on the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B75@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has at least one solution in the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B72@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for all x in the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

content.answer: <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C22@</annotation> </semantics> </math> has at least one solution in the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
